channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Author Geraldine Brooks learned some hard personal-finance lessons when her husband died unexpectedly
item.description: “Memorial Days” is a memoir of grief, but also a practical reminder of the impact of money on anyone’s life.

item.title: AutoNation’s stock rises as higher car prices help it beat sales and profit estimates
item.description: Customers shrugged off higher prices and drove up sales, while AutoNation said it’s well positioned to handle higher tariffs.

item.title: Charter is bleeding internet subscribers — and the stock could see its worst day ever
item.description: A downbeat earnings report, plus investor disdain for the pending Cox Communications merger, is sending the stock to a one-year low.

item.title: PayPal’s ‘battleground’ stock heads for longest winning streak in years. Earnings are on deck.
item.description: PayPal’s stock is on track to rise for the eighth session in a row, but analysts have a hard time making a call about the future.

item.title: Social Security Administration quietly corrects blog on taxation of benefits — but confusion persists
item.description: Public comments on the agency’s blog show beneficiaries remain confused about the new law.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...
